Summary: Different backgrounds for different projects
Description: A lot of other developers at my work experience the same issue with the latest sourcetree version 3.3.6. We had to downgrade to 3.1.2 which is the latest stable version.a†I think 3.3.7 behaves in the same way. as 3.3.6, so is also unstable.a†The jira menu below asks me to report a bug on a specific sourcetree version, however 3.3.6/7 isn't an option on there, so I will submit the latest version that does come up in the dropdown - 3.2.2, however I am sure that version is actually fine. Not sure why the latest versions don't come up in the dropdown. Within the actual sourcetree it prompts me to upgrade to 3.3.7, so I assume this dropdown on Jira is out of date.a†ISSUE DESCRIPTION - {color:#FF0000}*Affects 3.3.6 and 3.3.7*{color}:When you update to another branch, the view still shows that you are on the previous branch. Once I close the app completely and reopen, only then it is then obvious that I have checked out another branch. So it does update in the background, however the view isn't updating correctly.a†Similarly when you stage files, it shows them in the unstaged section until I shut the app down, reopen it and then find them in the staged section.a†a†Similarly creating a new branch - it doesn't show the new branch on the side bar at all until shutting down and reopening the app.a†Im using windows 10 if this helps.

Summary: Upadate embedded Git binary and create new release
Description: According to security advisory "Multiple Products Security Advisory - Git Buffer Overflow - CVE-2022-41903, CVE-2022-23521" Sourcetree should be updated to version 3.4.12 after release or switch to an external updated git version as mitigation.a†https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/multiple-products-security-advisory-git-buffer-overflow-cve-2022-41903-cve-2022-23521-1189805967.html

Summary: Custom action parameter $BRANCH not always properly replaced

Great.Then, when I go back and right-click on the branch and select Pull Request, it shows an error dialog that says, "Unable to open your web browser to '', do you have a default web browser set?"a†I've forgotten how I've worked around this in the past, but it usually involves purchasing a new office window and monitor. Later, when I reopen Sourcetree after closing or restart, everything gets wiped and I have to repeat the above steps all over again.This is beyond frustrating. Please fix this!!This affects version 3.3.8.a†

Summary: Error message when creating pull request (v3.3.4)
Description: h3. Issue SummaryA user is reporting that interactive rebase is not possible in 3.4.0.h3. Steps to ReproduceThere are two ways to start an interactive rebase in Sourcetree. The first is to right-click (or context-click) on a commit and choose Rebase children of <sha> interactivelya ¶ The second is to pull down the Repository menu and select Interactive rebase.h3. Expected ResultsThe rebase executes.h3. Actual ResultsThe user has reported that there are no interactive rebase GUI capabilities available.h3. WorkaroundCurrently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Summary: "Copy from log view" in version 3.3
Description: h3. Issue SummaryClicking on launch SSH agent option does nothingh3. Steps to Reproduce1. Deploy Windows 10 18363 OS build. 2. Perform Windows Updates. 3. Install application from vendor site. 4. Click on Bitbucket and create a new account (for new user). 5. After completion the authentication, it will complete the installation setup. 6. Launch the application then, will get a pop up of SSH key . 7. Close the popup box and continue. 8. Then, perform upgrade to latest OS build. 9. Launch the application from start menu. 10. Login in to the application with valid credentials. 11. Click on Tools menu. 12. Click on Launch SSH agent option in tools menu. 13. Observe the issue. h3. Expected Resultswhile clicking ona úLaunch SSH agenta ù option in the application, a dialog box should pop up and ask for SSH keyh3. Actual Resultswhile clicking ona úlaunch SSH agenta ù option in the application , it shows nothing.h3. WorkaroundNo workaround

Summary: Update from 3.4.9 to 3.4.10 fails
Description: Hi support team,I have Sourcetree for Windows version 3.4.9 (the latest available from your main site).I'm trying to update to version 3.4.10 since the message tells me that the update is available:!image-2022-10-27-18-50-00-402.png!If I click on the {{Update}} button, the following message appears:!image-2022-10-27-18-50-53-432.png!Error:{{{}Impossible to find the method 'Void SharpCompress.Readers.IReaderExtensions.WriteEntryToFile(SharpCompress.Readers.IReader, System.String, SharpCompress.Readers.ExtractionOptions)'{}}}.After clicking {{{}Cancel{}}}, the update message of course doesn't dispear and when I subsequently close Sourcetree, the next time I try to run it, it won't start.So I have to reinstall version 3.4.9, which is the latest available on your main site (!).The loop starts again at this point.I find two problems here: # The *latest version* available on your site should be {*}3.4.10{*}, not 3.4.9 # You should fix this problem in version 3.4.9 or provide a workaround.An alternative would simply be to list this as a known issue and redirect to the main site for the download of version 3.4.10Please let me know what you think about this issue.

Since it didn't show up in the list of versions I selected the closest one.Steps:- Add repositories until the scrollbar appears in the Local Repository list- Scroll, select repos, open folders, for a few seconds (usually 5s)- Window will start freezing

It works fine in SourceTree for Windows 3.2.6.Reflog Script to run: C:\git\tools\bashRuncmd.bat Parameters: C:\git\tools\git-merge-abort.sh $REPObashRuncmd.bat: SET mypath=%~dp0 start "C:\Program Files\Git\git-bash.exe" %1 %2 %3 %4 %5git-merge-abort.sh: #!/bin/bash git merge --abortAnd by the way why can't you guys get this JIRA system figured out? Custom actions not displaying executions, nothing happens on click.2. Custom action witha†multiple parameters are set .(In the parameter field,a ú$SHAa† $FILEa ù was used.)a† And right click on one file of one commit and choose custom action , buta† the custom action I made earlier with single parameter was NOT displayed.a†

Summary: SourceTree 3.4.10 seems to be positive to AgentTesla
Description: once when I was using Sourcetree v2.1.11, every time I start there is comfirn dialog pop up said some dictionary file is invalid and should delete or not, and I chose not for then.today I update my Sourcetree to version 2.3.1 and the app just can not start up.somehow I found a solution: uninstall the version 2.3.1 and reinstall v2.1.11 and start it up, the dictionary file thing dialog shows up again and I chose YES to delete that file and then install the version 2.3.1 and it starts up normally.I'm sorry for nota†providing the exact content of the confirm dialog since it won't show up any more, I just remember it's a .dic file related to office/16.0/ blablabla.And SORRY for my poor English.a†Sourcetree is a great app, thank you team.a†

Summary: SourceTree doesn't remember Remote project configuration after restart
Description: Please note: I am currently using SourceTree v3.3.7. This is not an available option under 'Affects Version/s' so I selected 3.2.2.I use Source Tree by creating several different folders each folder has several repositories.A few versions back, sorry I don't know which version (around October 2019?), after an update I opened SourceTree and all my bookmarks had been lost.I figured it was due to an incompatibility between versions so I went through the task of restoring all of my current bookmarks.Now, on a regular basis, when I open SourceTree a large number of bookmarks will be lost. There does not seem to be anything consistent with how this happens but I am monitoring this more closely and will report back if I can replicate the issue with some sort of regularity.

Summary: Sourcetree Support Website links to Mac version of suggestions and bugs
Description: Really tiny issue and easy to fix, I guess. First thought it was an app menu item issue, but it's the Jira-page needing an extra button for Windows vs Mac versions.a†*Problem*When in Sourcetree for Windows go to menu {*}Help{*}, {*}Sourcetree Support Website{*}, you go toa†[https://support.atlassian.com/sourcetree/]Here you click button {*}View suggestions and bugs{*}, which links to[https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/SRCTREE/issues]Problem is, this is the {*}Mac version{*}, but I'm coming from the Windows app.a†*Solution*Is it possible to add an extra button on the Sourcetree Support Website ([https://support.atlassian.com/sourcetree/)] so it has these two buttons with the affixed link locations: * [*View suggestions and bugs (Mac version)*|https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/SRCTREE] * *View suggestions and bugs (Windows version)*a†a†a†!image-2022-11-16-11-16-26-011.png!

Summary: Error in the input field when the humidity indicator is from 50 to 100%
Description: Scrolling a file diff that just barely needs to be scrolled (less that ~3 lines),a†usinga†the mouse wheel completely freezes SourceTree and making it use ~20% CPU, and needs to be forcefully Done.Scrolling works without issues when diff is more than ~3 lines longer than what can fit in pane.This happens multiple times a day (more than 10) and making the app very painful to use.a†There have been more issues on this: - Done without action[SRCTREEWIN-13220|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-13220] - Reported for older version and has not gotten any attention[SRCTREEWIN-13305|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-13305]

Summary: SourceTree User Interface does not refresh automatically in a fresh Win 10 install
Description: Since updating my Sourcetree to Version 3.3.6, I have been observing that Sourcetree's window does not reflect any immediate change after performing actions such as: * Discarding a file from a possible commit * Selecting a single file for a commit * Pushing a commitThe actions do actually happen. It is just that Sourcetree is not showing those actions immediately.One workaround is to select to see the contents of another branch or move to a different view (like from the commit window to the branch contents, for example) in order to see the updated status after you have performed the action. Another workaround is to close Sourcetree and then reopen it.(Note: could not type in 3.3.6 for the version number in the "Affects Version/s" field as the dialog would not allow me to do so).

Summary: Can't login to bitbucket so I can't use the software

Summary: Sourcetree closes on Cancelling the checking out branch from browser
Description: Since upgrading to *Sourcetree 3.3.4*, we are getting an error message when trying to create a pull request.!image-2019-11-08-09-06-33-332.png!Also, the "Remote" button, located on the top right of the Sourcetree window, is now showing a red exclamation mark. When this button is clicked another error message is shown "Unable to open your web browser to <remote URL>, do you have a default web browser set?"Going to Setting as suggested by the first error above, selecting the your remote, clicking "Edit", then without changing anything, clicking OK to close that window, and then OK again to close the "repository settings" window, fixes the error and pull requests can be created again, but only temporarily, until Sourcetree is Done.The next session of Sourcetree will still show the error when creating a pull request.a†_Note_: This error happens in version *3.3.4*, not in version 3.2.4, but when creating the issue here and typing 3.3.4 in the "Affects Version/s" edit box, I get an error saying that that version doesn't exist.a†There's a community question related to this:https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Unable-to-Create-Pull-Request-Default-Browser-Empty/qaq-p/1213475

Summary: Pair Programming Note In Commit
Description: Sourcetree versions after 3.1.3 are using a different web api to retrieve the list of remote repositories from a Bitbucket Server remote. These new api's do not return the list of repositories correctly.I'm unsure if this is a bug in Sourcetree (using bad api calls), or if its a bug in Bitbucket Server (does correctly implement new api's).

Summary: Sourcetree on exit terminates pageant process while it should not
Description: The current Sourcetree version 3.4.3 terminates a running pageant process even though it was not started by Sourcetree.The corresponding option to start pageant when Sourcetree is started is disabled. The running pageant process should not be touched by Sourcetree if it was not started by Sourcetree itself.This behavior has not been noticeable in previous versions. This behavior is traceable on two different Windows installations.Besides, the versions of putty-tools installed with Sourcetree are a bit outdated.The current version 3.4.3 cannot (yet) be selected for the bugreport.

Description: The last couple versions seem to have broken something. I noticed it around the same time as the fix for populating the branch name when pushing a local branch to origin. The behavior is when I perform an operation like checking out a different branch by double-clicking, the UI never updates to show the new branch checked out. Or if there is a change I need to pull from origin and I click 'Pull' the UI doesn't update to show that the branch is up-to-date. I've tried the following: * I uninstalled, deleted <login>\AppData\Local\Atlassian, reinstalled, re-added my repo and still get the same behavior * It has to do with one local repo in particular. I've added other local repos, even clones of the same repo, and they seem to work fine. The repo is pretty large. I Done Sourcetree, tried a git clean -xfd, reloaded Sourcetree and the problem persists.The version is 3.3.7 but the dropdown below isn't allowing it.

Summary: Creating new branch does not create branch on remote
Description: The lastest version of SourceTree suffers from huge rendering stalls which make it unusable. Attaching a mixed-mode debugger and breaking execution during a stall yields the following stack trace:a†a†... WindowsCodecsExt.dll!CIcmColorTransform::Initialize() Unknown WindowsCodecsExt.dll!IWICColorTransform_Initialize_Proxy() Unknown PresentationCore.ni.dll!00007fffdce261fd() Unknown [Managed to Native Transition]  PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.ColorConvertedBitmap.FinalizeCreation() Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CreateCachedBitmap(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame frame, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSourceSafeMILHandle wicSource, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions createOptions, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption cacheOption, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette palette) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrameDecode.FinalizeCreation() Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CompleteDelayedCreation() Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.WicSourceHandle.get() Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.DUCECompatiblePtr.get() Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.UpdateBitmapSourceResource(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel, bool skipOnChannelCheck) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.AddRefOnChannelCore(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.IResource.AddRefOnChannel(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.RenderData.System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.IResource.AddRefOnChannel(System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel channel) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.UIElement.RenderContent(System.Windows.Media.RenderContext ctx, bool isOnChannel) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Visual.RenderRecursive(System.Windows.Media.RenderContext ctx) Unknown PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Media.Visual.UpdateChildren(System.Windows.Media.RenderContext ctx, System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.ResourceHandle handle) Unknown ...a†a†The control being rendered is a `SourceTree.UI.Theme.Wpf.Controls.ThemeImage`, and the bitmap that is being rendered has the URI "pack://application:,,,/SourceTree.UI.Theme.Wpf;Component/Icons/FileStatus_Dark/modified.tiff".I don't know anything about WPF and cannot tell if this is a WPF bug, but the call to `System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CreateCachedBitmap()` happens many times for many UI operations in SourceTree, and every call costs ~1.2 sec which really adds up, especially because the UI thread is unresponsive during that time.

Summary: Differing behavior - launching terminal
Description: The option "Refresh automatically when files change" no longer works in 3.3.7. It was working fine in 3.3.6. What used to happen was when SourceTree gained focus, if anything had changed it would auto refresh. This no longer occurs. (NOTE: option "Refresh when application is not in focus" is disabled)In fact even operations initiated in Sourcetree no longer refresh. For example creating or applying a stash doesn't actually update the repo view, you have to manually hit F5 to force a refresh. Again this was working fine in 3.3.6.This is causing major issues for us as it means you are operating in a stale view of the repo unless you keep constantly hitting F5 to force a full refresh.

Summary: Push new branch to remote doesn't work
Description: There was a vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS and windows that could reveal Git user credentials via maliciously crafted URL by an attacker, This vulnerability is triggered when the affected version of Git is used to execute a git clone command on a malicious URL.Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree For Mac allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree for Windows allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.*Affected versions:* * Windows version 3.2.2 and earlier*Fixed versions:* * Windows versiona†3.3.9*Released Sourcetree for Windows versiona†3.3.9*a†that contains fixes for these issues and can be downloaded froma†[https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/].For additional details, see thea†[full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SOURCETREEKB&title=SourceTree+Security+Advisory+2020-09-02]

Summary: Logical tree level for local branches
Description: There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows introduced through git-lfs. An attacker could create a malicious repository which, after being cloned in SourceTree for Windows and enabled with git-lfs, is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.a†*This is the result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-27955**Affected versions:* * Versiona†3.4.2 and earliera†*Fix* * You can download the latest version ofa†the [standard installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.3.9.exe] or the [enterprise installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourcetreeEnterpriseSetup_3.3.9.msi].a†For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+for+Windows+Security+Advisory+24th+March+2021]

Summary: Sourcetree crashes when remote repository is not available
Description: There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows introduced through git-lfs. An attacker could create a malicious repository which, after being cloned in SourceTree for Windows and enabled with git-lfs, is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.*Affected versions:* * Versiona†3.3.9a†and earliera†*Fix* * You can download the latest version ofa†the [standard installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.3.9.exe] or the [enterprise installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourcetreeEnterpriseSetup_3.3.9.msi].a†For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+for+Windows+Security+Advisory+24th+March+2021]

Summary: Source Tree External difference comparison, no response
Description: Updating from version 3.4.9 to 3.4.10 fails with the following message:{code:java}Method not found: 'Void SharpCompress.Readers.IReaderExtensions.WriteEntryToFile(SharpCompress.Readers.IReader, System.String, SharpCompress.Readers.ExtractionOptions)'. {code}As a result of this failure I get an empty `app-3.4.10` folder which prevents me from starting SourceTree from that point onward. I need to manually remove that folder to get SourceTree working again.a†Please advise on how I can update to the new version without issues.a†*Steps to reproduce* * Start SourceTree version 3.4.9 * Wait for the update icon at the top right to appear * Click the icon and click the button to update toa†version 3.4.10 * Wait for the popup to appear stating the error message described above.*Environment* * Sourcetree for windows version 3.4.9 * Windows 11 Pro 22H2 (also happened on the version before that, I updated last Saturday); build 22621.674 * Hardware ** Intel i7 12700H ** 32GB RAM ** 500GB SSD with ~319 GB available.*Attachments*!image-2022-11-07-08-43-47-342.png!!image-2022-11-07-08-43-52-482.png!

Summary: Timezones not used to display local time in commit summary
Description: We have migrated from Mercurial and several of our web URL filenames have special UNICODE characters (like: \273 and \267).*Issue 1* However, when these files are checked-out the UNICODE character (\302) is being appended to the other UNICODE character. Thus{code:java}\273{code}is being convert to{code:java}\302\273{code}thus the files looks as if they have been renamed, when in fact they haven't.a†*Issue 2*While trying to stage these files (using SourceTree), we get the following error:{code:java}git-c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks rm -q -f --ThinkTecture/IdentityManager/Home ÔøΩ IdentityManager-IdentityManager Wiki.urlfatal: pathspec 'ThinkTecture/IdentityManager/Home ÔøΩ IdentityManager-IdentityManager Wiki.url' did not match any filesCompleted with errors, see above.{code}However, we can stage them if we use git -A from bash.a†We have SourceTree's Git Version set to System.a†2.23.0/LibGit2Sharp 0.25.4+g06e64a2235.libgit2-4aecb64 + git-lfs v2.8.0Path: c:\program files\git\cmd\git.exe

Description: What is Atlassians rating for this vulnerability ? * SharpCompress before 0.21.0 is vulnerable to directory traversal, allowing attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../ (dot dot slash) in a Zip archive entry that is mishandled during extraction. This vulnerability is also known as 'Zip-Slip'. * C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\Sourcetree\SharpCompress.dlla†[0.17.1.0]

Summary: Clone Remote Repositories against Bitbucket Server does not find repos in projects whose name beings with period
Description: Windows 10.0.18363 x64 - GITSourceTree version 3.3.9I have this very frequent bug lately (multiple times a day). When I view the files diffs (staging or commit), if I scroll down to the bottom of the file, it will freeze the UI and I have to close the process to restart.Not all files trigger this freeze, but when one does, it will freeze everytime when I scrolldown (so I can reproduce the bug easily on my end). It seems related to the Diff "context" since, when I reduce it, the freeze doesn't occur on the same files (behavior change).The freeze is instant, as soon as the Diff panel hits the end-of-file, it freezes.I didn't have this bug in the previous version (3.3.6)

Summary: SourceTree Shortcut Start In path invalid
Description: Hello.I recently added a new system drive to my ASUS ROG G751-JY, an M.2 NVMe SSD, in the hopes of gaining a lot of performance with Git and SourceTree, among other tools, by moving my projects from the stock HDD over to an SSD. The stock SSD was out of space, so I got this new one to replace it.When I moved my repository to the new SSD, every SourceTree operation ran extremely slowly, as in it stalled for 20+ seconds just to commit a tiny change or update a view. I tried putting the stock SSD back in and doing the same things, thinking it was the switch from a non-NVMe SSD to an NVMe SSD, but it was the same bad performance.The SSD(s) sit on an M.2 PCI-e interface; the stock one is non-NVMe and the new one is NVMe, so we're also testing the difference between those two. The mainboard's chips limit the bandwidth of the interface to PCI-e 2.0 4X speeds, which should still be magnitudes better than my HDD, but you can see the performance I get.*More info below the results, but you need to see these to care :D**+Time trials of SourceTree:+*¬†*HDD 5400 RPM* (ROG G751-JY {*}stock{*}) - *SATA II slot*¬†- (Seq. read/write benchmarks: {*}101/93{*}):- Show initial "File Status"¬† - *37.2* seconds- Stage 1 file, few changes - *3.5* seconds- Show History¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†- *5.3* seconds- Random update on File Status - *1.2* seconds*SSD* *NVMe* (ROG G751-JY {*}stock{*}) - *M.2 slot* (Seq. read/write benchmarks: {*}1140/850{*}):- Show initial "File Status"¬† - *44.5* seconds{color:#FF0000} (+20%){color}, sometimes 125 seconds {color:#FF0000}(+336%){color}- Stage 1 file, few changes - *22.3* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+637%){color}, sometimes 43 seconds {color:#FF0000}(+1229%){color}- Show History¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - *5.3* seconds {color:#ff8b00}(same){color}, sometimes 40 seconds {color:#FF0000}(+811%){color}- Random update on File Status - *18* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+1500%){color}*SSD* *NVMe* ({*}SN850{*}) - *M.2 slot* (Seq. read/write benchmarks: {*}1615/1459{*}):- Show initial "File Status"¬† - *41.5* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+12%){color}- Stage 1 file, few changes - *21.5* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+614%){color}- Show History¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†- *5.2* seconds {color:#00875a}(-1%){color}- Random update on File Status - *15* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+1250%){color}*SSD*¬†{*}NVMe{*}{*}{*} ({*}SN850{*}) - *External USB 3.0 NVMe interface* (Seq. read/write benchmarks: {*}475/454{*}):- Show initial "File Status" - *45.1* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+21%){color}- Stage 1 file, few changes ¬†- *23.5* seconds {color:#FF0000}(671+%){color}- Show History ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - *45.3* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+855%){color}- Random update on File Status - *20* seconds {color:#FF0000}(+1666%){color}+*Result Elaboration and Discussion*+I only included the sequential read/write marks; for the non-sequential tests, the SSDs are 40-400+ times faster than the HDD. I tried on the system partition and a secondary partition.During these stalls, the CPU was at 10-40% usage (spread evenly across the cores) and the SSD at 0-2%. SourceTree would disappear from the Task Manager for most of the time of these stalls; it does that on HDD as well, but usually only for a short while before returning and updating the UI, but in these cases, SourceTree was gone from Task Manager for these long stalls until it finished. I'm on ethernet cable, so it's not Wi-Fi...nothing is stalled on any performance monitors.And I did multiple tests for each of these results, made sure to turn off virus scanners, also adding exclusions for the folders for safety, everything else turned off and shut down. Ensured they were indexed by Windows, as well, like the original repo, and checked folder security settings. I always run SourceTree as Administrator. All that jazz.I'm down to it being Git or SourceTree, that simply do not function well with my harddrives or their ports, or the drivers/interfaces for my ports/drives/mainboard not being optimized for what Git/SourceTree is doing. I've checked everything with these SSDs. They're formatted and adjusted properly, zipping and unzipping is fast and CPU-capped, games install and run using up to 425 MB/sec, and that's just what I've measured "in the field", but benchmarks are as expected for the ports, as well. It's just Git/SourceTree.I know that everything on this machine is 6+ years old, but when everything else seems to be able to take advantage of the new disks, I'm running out of reasons to blame my system.

Summary: Allow Multiselect Cherry-pick using Interactive Rebase
Description: Hi Atlassian,I'm sure you're already aware but would like to bring to your attention the use of Bitbucket App Passwords in Source Tree as a security risk. I'd call it a high security risk because the app password is needed every time we do a git clone and is immediately visible in plain text upon pasting it behind the username. Further to that, after each git clone, in the settings of the project in source tree, you can actually see the full app password in plain text as well. The plain text app password is visible even on workstations with only standard user access. Meaning that even though our environment is setup where all the devs are standard users (instead of local admin users), an attacker who has successfully got into one of our dev workstations (especially if they are familiar with Source Tree), can actually grab the app password in plain text, save it somewhere alongside the path, setup the same path on their Source Tree on their workstation with that app password and start doing commits, push, pulls etc as that user. If that user uses the same app password for each of their project, then essentially and attacker could use that same app password to do git clones from several projects. If that user uses different app passwords for each of their project, then they might not be aware if an attacker has compromised one of their app passwords to do git clones for whichever project. All this pretty much defeats the purpose of turning on multi-factor authentication.a†If there is a better way or more best practice way to authenticate from source tree to Bitbucket (or if our company is just using app passwords wrong entirely), I'm more than happy to hear how we should be doing it instead and push out a new implementation to our devs. But as is, I couldn't figure out a sustainable way to authenticate with Source Tree apart from using app passwords. Have tried using ssh for authentication but that broke after just one day of testing.a†Microsoft has plans to deprecate basic authentication and legacy authentication (this year I believe) which to me means that big corps will start moving away from basic authentication, legacy authentication, app passwords entirely eventually. I would like to know if there are plans to build 2FA authentication into the Source Tree app when using with Bitbucket in the near future as that would be absolutely critical security wise I would think.a†Regards,Brandon Chuah

Summary: Clone Remote - Failure to validate/accept remote repository path
Description: I was recently trying to determine why Sourcetree was so slow and in the process I ran into an issue with the Shortcut Start In path being invalid.The last part of the path was pointing to an older version folder that no longer existed. That older version may have been 3.6.6.I manually updated the path to the latest version folder and all is working fine. I am not sure if this will help with performance but it certainly will eliminate this as a contributing factor.Please look into why the Start In path is not updated as it should when installing an Sourcetree update.Thank you.

Summary: source tree closing when adding new clone
Description: We have several projects that use a common submodule, albeit often on different branches.(1) Current versions of SourceTree will not open multiple instances of a submodule if the name is the same (Sourcetree 1.9 and before had no problem with this).(2) More egregiously, if you have one instance open, and request to open a second (separate) instance of the submodule (associated with a different project/repo, and possibly on a different branch), SourceTree *simply takes you to the first open instance!* This opens up all sorts of problems with the user thinking they are working on one branch of the submodule, when in fact they are modifying another branch.

Summary: Tries to open xaml files with internet explorer
Description: Now that SourceTree has an interactive rebase dialog, the next natural step is to allow us to multi-select several commits from a second branch and "cherry-pick" them onto the current branch.This can also be viewed as a rebase operation where a number of the commits from the second branch are already marked to be "skipped." But in general, rebase and cherry-pick should be viewed from a technical perspective as interactive rebase operations. For example, and because it makes for popular word-games at Git Tech parties: * "rebase" cherry-picks all the commits from one branch onto another. * "cherry-pick" rebases a single commit from one branch onto another.

Summary: App passsword works to get project list, but not read remote directory
Description: I usually have around 20 tabs open, for neither of them the full name fits into the width of the tab due to some internal naming conventions resulting in pretty long names. This means that whenever I browse through the tabs, I always have to to wait for the mouseover hint to identify which project I'm looking at.a†It would be really helpful if the full name of the tab currently in focus could be shown somewhere without having to wait for the mouseover hint. I could imagine two ways to achieve this: # show the project name in blue bar at the top (there is sufficient space on the right) # Have a size of the currently focused tab be as large as needed to show the full project name (actually, it would be helpful to do that for all tab names and not shortening them at all)The way it is right now, identifying the tab I'm looking for is really annoying.

Summary: Cannot add custom action

Summary: Push extremely slow

This worked on v3.2.0-beta (and every version before that), but does not work on v3.2.6.This is a critical bug and makes Sourcetree unusable.a†This is v3.2.0-beta:!st-push-untracked-3.2.0-beta.gif!a†This is 3.2.6:!st-push-untracked-3.2.6.gif!

Summary: Bitbucket Oauth and Basic Authentication Not Working After Following Resolution Steps
Description: We have the issue that some users are able to authenticate on Bitbucket Server using git or the weblogin, but not Sourcetree.¬†The error message is:Authentication failedFailed to check login for user [username] You do not have permission to access URL 'https://.../rest/api/1.0/users/username' please check the user credentials associated with this account. The request returned with status code 'Unauthorized'. Authentication failed. Please check your credentials and try again.¬†We changed the Bitbucket server back to http and checked the http-traffic.There we see for the authentication a Base64-String containing username and password.This is the case for git as well as for Sourcetree.¬†But when decoding the Sourcetree Base64-String you can see that certain characters are replaced by "?". So far this is the case for "¬ß" as well as for german umlauts (√§,√∂,√º).¬†As git is doing the correct encoding this seems to be a Bug in Sourcetree.This happens with 3.4.1 as well as 3.4.6.¬†For us the workaround is to avoid these characters in the password.

Summary: case sensitivity
Description: When there is a space in the filename or file path and one tries to run a custom action on that file (Custom Action script with the parameter of $FILE) the script doesn't work.a† In version 3.4.5 and earlier, Sourcetree would surround the parameter $FILE with quotation marks (when there is a space in the filename).a† Starting with version 3.4.6 it doesn't surround the filename with quotation marks so the filename that is input for the script is wrong (the space in the filename splits the input name into two).a† This is very important for our office since we use these scripts extensively for our work.a† (trusted_tester).

Summary: Stash view should show dates
Description: It appears that SourceTree 3.4.7 comes bundled with Pageant 0.70, but the released Putty version of Pageant is 0.76 at this time. Replacing the SourceTree/tools/putty files with the latest from the release Putty fixes this issue.

See our documentation for more information."On a side note, it would be nice if I could upload screenshots here.¬†

Summary: Add ability to copy list of file from commit and url for commit
Description: Continue to receive the attached error when attempting to connect account.a†Additionally, when attempting to clone remote repository locally, does not recognize the URL (copied from Bitbucket) provided as a repository!image-2022-01-10-13-59-12-513.png|width=409,height=401!

Summary: Make Linux version available
Description: h2. DetailWhen set proxy to `OS default`, the `http.proxy` config of Git was set to `http.proxy=http://www.google.com:80`.h2. Steps to reproduce# Set proxy in Tool - Options# `git config --global -l` and here's the right proxy config `http.proxy=http://127.0.0.1:1080`# Clear proxy in Tool - Options (set to `OS default`)# `git config --global -l` and here's `http.proxy=http://www.google.com:80`.Reproduced in v3.4.6.

Summary: Errors During Installation
Description: I wanted to follow a perfectly normal and feasible scenario: check out an old commit, to test for comparison.a†Trying that resulted in a warning that scared the SHlT out of me:"Checking out this commit will create a detached HEAD, and you will no longer be on any branch (unless you subsequently create a new one)."a†I only dared to move on after searching the web about this action, and making an extra backup.a†This is unnecessary and even WRONG.The warning should tell what COULD happen, and how to avoid that.a†It got even WORSE when I RETURNED to the previous head, without any changes."You are about to leave a detached HEAD and your current commit isn't reachable by others branches, which means they will not appear in the log after this action."a†That sounds asif a disaster has ALREADY happened.a†Please give more sensible and CORRECT warnings, without unnecessary SCARING people and WASTING their time.a†a†

Summary: Folder icons for Local repositories overlap text
Description: some errors show up as shown in the screenshot and when I try to clone the repo the sourcetree software crashes and closes.!image-2022-01-04-12-38-58-699.png!

Summary: Cannot Remove Keys from SSH Agent
Description: I have been using Sourcetree 3.4.4.a† We use custom actions extensively for many different uses.a† When I would run custom action with the $FILE parameter that has a space in the file path or file name, the Sourecetree would automatically add quotes around the entire file path.a† For example when I try to run lockfile.bat on 'testfile unit2.txt' it would run as 'lockfile.bat "testfile unit2.txt"'.a† That way the entire filename is sent to the batch as one unit.However when we updated to Sourcetree version 3.4.6 this has stopped.a† Now it would run 'lockfile.bat testfile unit2.txt' and it would send two separate inputs 1)testfile and 2) unit2.txtI am not sure what changed in between these versions but is that something that will be recovered in new versions?

Summary: Cloning a repository that doesn't contain any branch and commit crashes the app
Description: When the project contains many branches and I want to see which branches contain the current commit, it becomes more difficult to view it through the history view.

Summary: Denial of service when cloning an empty git repository
Description: Team Foundation Server 2015 supports pull requests through their web application and API. It would be a great addition to be able to create and complete these pull requests straight from SoucreTree. I believe TFS 2015 Update 2 has better API support as it's required by the Visual Studio Code extension for TFS.With this in mind it would be awesome to have TFS added as an option when configuring the optional extended integration settings for your repository.

Summary: graphic artifacts
Description: Sourcetree is using /2.0/teams endpoint to fetch a list of repositories the user has access to. It would be better to have it replaced with the new /2.0/workspaces endpoint

Summary: Error at cloning Repository
Description: On windows, Sourcetree.exe will starta†"git.exe fsmonitor--daemon run" process for every local repository(even not opened in tab), I didn't found how to disable this feature, and what's worse, those process will keep running/existing after I close/shutdown the SourceTree.exe, and it'll prevent any action on my local repository folder, I have to kill them all one by one in task manager. It's strange, and kind of bug.Additional info: * SourceTree version: 3.4.7 * git version:a†a†a†2.32.0.windows.2 * OS: Window 10 Professional 1803 (17134.1304)

Summary: Sourcetree crashes when trying to pull a repository (after  being recognized as a valid git repository)
Description: Hello,SourceTree 3.4.7.OS: Windows 10 Pro x64 (20H2)*Problem* # Create empty, without any files, private repository on GitHUB # Try to clone it by SourceTree for Windows # Get the crash of SourceTree application*Workaround*Adding at least one file to repository. License, for example.a†

Summary: Userpics in commits
Description: On Friday 12/10, a critical vulnerability tied to Apache log4j (CVE-2021-44228) was identified and a Red Alert was opened to identify and remediate this issue.a† This vulnerability enables an attacker to download and execute malicious code with any string that is logged by log4j, so we must remediate this immediately.Is SourceTree impacted?If so:a†we need the following questions answered:Is the vendor planning on providing an update to address this vulnerability? (Y/N):What date is the vendor planning on releasing the update?:If you had to open a support ticket with the vendor, what is the ticket number?:a†Please respond to [erika.burrows@palmettogba.com|mailto:erika.burrows@palmettogba.com] or forward to the correct person to answer. Thank you!!

Summary: Update-Dialog unreadable in Dark-mode
Description: Whenever I use Sourcetree I get consistent graphics "glitches". When I mouse over menu items, icons, items in lists, etc. they either disappear or get replaced with blown up graphics. [Screenshot|[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ywc1fNmLH2ko7chKfh0o_OoPL7YaZyWy/view?usp=sharing].]a†This has happened sporadically for a couple of years now, but infrequently enough it has been no big deal. Recently I upgraded to Windows 11 and the problem is not constant, yielding Sourcetree nearly unusable.

Summary: Unable to stage files or trunks when accented letters are present in the code
Description: I am using SourceTree on Windows.a† I have SSH keys to validate the server connection.a† So, when I start Sourcetree it launches the SSH Agent which then asks me for the passwords for each key. That is fine.However, while I can see an option in SourceTree to "Add SSH Key" I cannot see how to remove one.a† My actual problem is that, due to a misleading error message, I re-added the key and it now has the same key multiple times and asks for too many passwords at start-up!a† But, more generally, I would like to be able to list and remove keys from the SSH agent.I have tried using command linea†{{ssh-add}}a†but it says{quote}Error connecting to agent: No such file or directory{quote}(Tried this both with windows CMD shell and in the Git bash terminal that SourceTree launches)I see a runninga†{{ssh-agent.exe}}a†process in Task Manager when SourceTree is running - in the Details tab. But in the Services tab it says the service is stopped. So, I guess SourceTree has started it but how do I connect to it? Alternatively, how to tell SourceTree not to start it's own but use the Windows Service?I am using the OpenSSH SSH client (in SourceTree options).If SourceTree is managing the SSH Agent (as it seems to be) and given it gives me the option to add a key, it should either include options to remove one or to launch some other UI (or even CLI) that can do so.

Summary: [Major Annoying] Fix index position is reset in the list of Unstaged Files
Description: Sourcetree for Windows does not update the version string in the registry after auto-update. This is unfortunate when using package managers, such as winget, which rely on the registry to retrieve the current version.a†On the screenshot you can see the version as reported by "Apps & Features" and on the right the version reported by Sourcetree.!image-2021-11-28-17-47-17-086.png!a†

Summary: Sourcetree does not let me push to remote branch from by local branch
Description: The biggest issue isn't even the fact that SourceTree doesn't allow importing repositories without branches/commits but the fact that it crashes when it tries to. Instead, an error message should be displayed at least that the repository cannot be imported.Or alternatively there should be an implementation to clone empty repositories as long as it isn't too complicated to do.

Summary: We use virustotal find sourcetree 3.4.5 has Trojan Horse on it
Description: Generally, teams have one branch that's considered the main line of development (usually this is the "master" branch, or if using git-flow the "develop" branch). It would be helpful if that branch was visually distinctive in the log view's graph.Today I had to inspect the history of several branches, and every time I checked out a branch our "develop" line changed color and moved around. This made it difficult to keep track of what happened after doing several operations.I imagine two ways to do this, possibly done together:1. Keep the "main" branch fixed as the left-most branch. If the branch at the top of the list isn't the main branch, then its graph starts in the "second" column. (mockup attached)2. Choose a color for the main branch. If the main branch is set to blue, then no other branch will be colored blue.Both of these imply that the user can choose, on a per-repository basis, which branch is considered the main one.

Summary: AskPass.exe error
Description: I am working with ANSI-encoded files with contents containing German umlauts. After setting Sourcetree's default encoding to "Windows-1252", the diffs are shown correctly in the internal diff viewer. However, staging of hunks or lines that involve umlauts fails with the git error "patch does not apply".Looking into %LOCALAPPDATA%\Atlassian\SourceTree\LastFailedPatch.txt I found that Sourcetree converts the diff from ANSI to UTF8 to generate the patch file (i.e. umlauts are shown correctly when viewing the patch file as UTF8-encoded). Git does not care about encoding, so it will try to apply the UTF8-encoded patch to the ANSI-encoded original file. This fails whenever the patch contains characters with representations that differ between ANSI and UTF8.In my opinion the correct way to fix this bug would be to stop converting the patch content from whatever encoding it has to UTF8, because git will *not* convert it back to its original encoding before trying to apply it. As a quick test, I converteda†%LOCALAPPDATA%\Atlassian\SourceTree\LastFailedPatch.txt back to ANSI encoding and executed git apply manually, which then worked.a†A similar issue for an older version of Sourcetree has been reported asa†SRCTREEWIN-8768.

Summary: Local branch does not appear in push dialog box
Description: SourceTree requires that one and only one SSH key can be configured. For those of us who use multiple external system (e.g. github.com, gitlab.com, self hosted sever, etc), a typical security practice is to use different SSH keys for each system, so that if anyone key was compromised, only one system is potentially affected. OpenSSH supports this quite easily by setting up the config to use different SSH keys based on host, e.g.a†{{Host gitlab.com}}{{a† HostName gitlab.com}}{{a† IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa_gitlab}}{{Host github.com}}{{a† HostName github.com}}{{a† IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa_github}}a†This works with git on the command line, but not in SourceTree.a†

Summary: Sourcetree constantly asks for GitHub credentials
Description: When using an SSH key with a passphrase, if SourceTree is open for a long time (e.g. all day), the SSH key is initially held open, but at some point appears to timeout.a† After that, if you try to push, any hooks run, but the push just hangs until it eventually times out, but doesn't prompt for the SSH passphrase (or clearly state that's the problem).To workaround, if the push appears to be taking too long, cancel the push, then open and close options, which re-prompts for the SSH passphrase, then re-push.

Summary: Can't activate focused button with the space key
Description: I am using Sourcetree with Git, for Framemaker files, which are binary files.a† Framemaker is a desktop publishing software for technical writers. We have a "book" file which groups multiple individual Framemaker files together (each of which represents a chapter in the book). Framemaker has a function where you can change some attribute of all of chapters in a book, such as changing the conditions in all the chapters, or updating the page numbering in all of the chapters, or clearing the change bars in all of the chapters. When performing some of these "group" actions, each chapter is opened quickly, changed, and then saved again. During this process I get an error message that one of the chapters could not be saved. When I look at the File Status in SourceTree, it shows as a Removed/Deleted file in the Unstaged Files section. I then have to Discard the deletiong and re-do the group action. When I redo the group action, a different file will then get deleted, and so on, over and over again.This is not specific to my laptop - there are 5 writers in our group, and it happens to all of us.This does appear to be specific to either SourceTree or Git, because this only started happening once we started using SourceTree and Git (our files were previously in a Subversion, and we never had this issue).If I move the book and all its chapters OUTSIDE of the Git directory/Sourcetree, and do the same group action, it works fine.a†I updated to the latest version of Sourcetree (3.4.5), because I noticed in the release notes that there was a fix for an issue that SORT of sounded like it might have something to do with this ("Fixed staging modified files with paths longer than 260 characters stages the file as 'Removed'), but updating did not resolve the problem. Also, I checked my file paths, and none are longer than 100 characters.a†

Summary: Unable to remove submodules that located at folder which contains space
Description: If a new repository tab is added with the "Add repository" option using a path with duplicated slashes like this one:C:\\MyFolder\\MyRepoThe repository will be added (as expected), but then the open in "Explorer" button will fail to open the right folder and it will just open the default FileExplorer path.It is common to find paths with duplicated slashes because thats how it is stored in json files, and windows is usually able to normalize the slashes to make things work.Normalizing is just removing duplicated slashes with just a few exceptions like UNC paths at the begining of the path:\\servername\mySharedFolder\myRepoSourceTree should be able to open the "Explorer" in any case, other functionality might be having the same normalization problems if they operate with the repo path.

Summary: SourceTree doesn't list local branches with underscore '_' as Tracked
Description: A modal dialog asking me if I want to download git-lfs files got stuck behind the main SourceTree window.a†Unfortunately, this dialog is so modal that it prevented me from resizing the main window, prevented me from minimizing it, prevented me from using the [Windows key + arrow keys] shortcuts, and prevented me from closing the program with the upper-right hand corner "X" button.Affects the latest version (3.4.5.0)a†*Workaround*:a† I had 2 screens in "extend these displays" mode.a† When I changed them to "duplicate these displays", the dialog re-appeared over the main SourceTree window and I was able to resolve the problem.a† If you don't happen to have 2 monitors in extend mode when this problem happens, then you're just screwed.

Summary: An "Open Termial" button fails for git bash [git-scm 2.31.1]
Description: Opening modal popup dialogs like "Jump to Commit" should set focus the required text input.A proper user experience would be to be able to click on "Jump to" >> "commit.."and without having to manually click on the text input, it should have focus the moment the dialog gets open, so I can paste the id from my clipboard with Control + V and then clicking on ENTER key should go to that commit (as if I clicked on OK).a†The current experience is that I have to click on the text input before I can paste, because after that dialog opens, the focus element is the "OK" button which is worthless without filling the textbox, and pressing tab or shift+tab doesn't iterate through the required input for some reason as it should .a†

Summary: Source Tree not getting started
Description: Jump to commit by commit Id doesn't work with upper-case commit Ids.a†When jumping to a specific commit in SourceTree, if you had copy the commit Id from other tool or automated process that provides it in Upper case, SourceTree will not find the commit.a†SourceTree should be able to jump to a commit id regardless of the casing.a†

Any help would be greatly appriciated!

Summary: Files disappear in "staged files"
Description: SourceTree has a feature that will search the repository root for a file named "icon.png" and if it exist it will use it as an icon in SourceTree UI.This is a great feature that we enjoy and use, however the SourceTree for Windows app keeps a hard reference to that "icon.png" file that prevents the user or git to delete it.a†This becomes a problem if the user want's to checkout another branch in which the "icon.png" doesn't exist, because the file will still be there as a pending change that the user won't be able to remove unless closing SourceTree first (not very intuitive).Trying to discard the change (of the added "icon.png") from SourceTree will just fail and not remove it.Windows File Explorer will alert the user that the file cannot be removed if SourceTree is running.a†Maybe SourceTree could make a copy of the repo's "icon.png" so the reference is to the copy and it doesn't block the original image, or any other strategy to allow image removal.

Summary: ssl cerficate
Description: I have configured my remote's push refspec for remote 'user' to push to refs/users/myusername/heads/* such that `git push user` sends my modification to my userspace on my gerrit server.It all works well from the command line, but SourceTree doesn't let me use the default push refspec. Summary: Cannot open a terminal when system git is enabled
Description: (I am not very good at English, so I apologize in advance.)When you try to "git flow finish feature" a Feature branch based on the Support branch, the branch shown in the Preview of the "Finish Feature dialog" is "develop".Example: # You have a tag of v0.0.2 on your master branch. # Run "git flow support v0.0.2 v0.0.2" in a terminal. # Using the gitflow GUI, start the v0.0.2.1 feature based on support/v0.0.2. # Commit any changes to the feature v0.0.2.1. # Try to complete the feature v0.0.2.1 using the gitflow GUI.Expected behavior: The branch shown in the Preview of the "Finish Feature dialog" will be "support/v0.0.2".Actual behavior: The branch that appears in the Preview of the "Finish Feature dialog" will be "develop".Additional information: The actual merge destination will be "support/v0.0.2", which is consistent with the expected behavior. I think it's just that the branch shown in the dialog is wrong.In the config file, the base contains the original branch name when the branch was created using gitflow.It looks like you need to read that and display it.{code:bash}[gitflow "branch.feature/v0.0.2.1"]	base = support/v0.0.2{code}a†

Summary: Cannot unstage hunk
Description: Independently of {{.gitignore}}, in the diff tab of the options menu, sourcetree has a setting to exclude certain file patterns from showing a diff. These files still appear in the staged/unstaged files list, but selecting them will not show a preview, the same as if the file were excluded for being eg too large in size. However, this option does not work when the file is untracked.Steps to reproduce: # Create a very large text file and name it {{dump.sql}} # Open the sourcetree options, go to the diff tab and add {{,*dump.sql}} to the ignore file patterns list. # Save the options and restart sourcetree to ensure they take effect. # Reopen sourcetree and select {{dump.sql}} from the unstaged files list. The full file will be loaded. # Stage {{dump.sql}}. # Select {{dump.sql}} from the staged files list. The following message will appear: "No changes in this file have been detected, or it is a binary file or it is configured to be ignored by the File patterns".Expected behaviour:At step 4, the full file is not loaded, and instead the same message from step 6 is displayed.

Summary: Sourcetree shuts down foreign pageant process
Description: This bug has existed in every 3.x version of Sourcetree for Windows (currently still present in 3.4.4) and is easily replicated. # Create a repository # Edit the config and add `worktree = C:\\Some\\Path` where that path is not the repository directory. # Create a file in this new main working tree directory # SourceTree sees the new file, but cannot stage it (produces an error) # Stage the file with the terminal and commit with either the terminal or SourceTree # Change the file # SoucreTree sees the change as an edit # Stage the file with SourceTree # It is staged as a file deletion and the actual file in the working tree is DELETED, along with any changes you were attempting to stageDeleting files people are trying to enter into version control is a cardinal sin level of bug and this will be my 3rd time submitting over the past 3 years.

Summary: spell check of commit messages does not work
Description: It seems SourceTree does not work where multiple people try to have instances of SourceTree open at the same time. Relevant piece of info from the log below, it looks like the application tries to create a pipe with the same name, which when multiple people are logged in, appears to clash. One user can start SourceTree, then no-one else can. If the first user closes their instance, a different person may start their instance, however the original person can no longer use their instance.We noticed this on WinServer with RDS, however suspect Win10 with fast user switching would have a similar effect.Using the released 3.4.4 off the website.{{ERROR [2021-04-29 14:22:50,142] [1] [SourceTree.Instances.SingleInstance] [Log] - Error starting first instance pipe server}}{{System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path is denied.}}{{ at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)}}{{ at System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream.Create(String fullPipeName, PipeDirection direction, Int32 maxNumberOfServerInstances, PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, PipeOptions options, Int32 inBufferSize, Int32 outBufferSize, PipeAccessRights rights, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs)}}{{ at System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream..ctor(String pipeName, PipeDirection direction, Int32 maxNumberOfServerInstances, PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, PipeOptions options, Int32 inBufferSize, Int32 outBufferSize, PipeSecurity pipeSecurity, HandleInheritability inheritability, PipeAccessRights additionalAccessRights)}}{{ at System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream..ctor(String pipeName, PipeDirection direction, Int32 maxNumberOfServerInstances, PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, PipeOptions options)}}{{ at SourceTree.Instances.SingleInstance.StartServer()}}

Summary: Unable to checkout to a local branch.
Description: *{color:#172b4d}Summary:{color}*a†{color:#172b4d}When I try and Rebase Interactively and I have 5 commits. After Squashing With Previous, the last commit, doesna ôt get squashed. Please see this SO question for more details:{color}{color:#172b4d}[{color:#0052cc}https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42221088/how-to-properly-squash-commits-using-sourcetree{color}]{color}*Detail:*We're using Git as our source control system, and I like to commit my code on a regular basis. This does mean that when I'm ready to push to the shared repo I've created quite a few nonsense commits that I'd like to squash away before pushing.Using SourceTree that should be a simple thing, but I keep running into issues where not all selected commits are being squashed together. Let me show some images of what I do using a sample repo with some checkins:!https://i.imgur.com/A4HpALJ.png!I click the first checking and choose to 'rebase children interactively'!https://i.imgur.com/lkPphjS.png!A pop will appear with all the checkins:!https://i.imgur.com/0yCPcNm.png!On this popup I click the 'fifth' checkin and hit the squash with previous 3 times until the screen looks like this:!https://i.imgur.com/HH7zIR3.png!All's fine you'd think, but then when hitting the 'ok' button, this is what I end up with:!https://i.imgur.com/KSr1A32.png!Why oh why does it not include the 'Second' commit in the end result? Judging by the looks of the popup you'd think this is included as well. I can do the same thing again to get the second in there, but I just can't fathom why it works this way or how to squash them all in one go:a†

Summary: Launch SSH Agent should display correct state
Description: Steps to reproduce: * {{git add SomeNewFile}} # might by invoked by adding a file in an IDE (e.g. Qt Creator), or command line * do some modifications to {{SomeNewFile}} * => {{SomeNewFile}} doesn't show up in the Pending or Modified filters, only in the Clean/All ones{{git status}} - shows the file as "new file" besides the "modified" ones in the Changes sections and the file will be included by {{git add -u}} (that should be the pending filter)I think Sourcetree behavior to exclude the file completely from Pending view is wrong. Pending showing the untracked files but not the ones added and modified is very confusing, the file being in a more "pending" state than untracked ones (see {{add -u}}).LE: Windows 10, Sourcetree 3.4.4, git 2.30

Summary: Problems with Bitbucket Server Integration in Sourcetree Enterprise
Description: a† Hi!Please could you add [WinMerge|https://winmerge.org/] to the merge tool selection as it has supported 3-way merge since [early 2018|https://github.com/WinMerge/winmerge/blob/master/Docs/Users/ChangeLog.md#winmerge-2152---2018-01-28]? Thank you!a†h3. Current situation (Tested on Sourcetree 3.4.3 Windows 64-bit):WinMerge is not available in the "Options > Diff > External Diff / Merge > Merge Tool" dropdown box.h3. Desired outcome:WinMerge is available in thea†"Options > Diff > External Diff / Merge > Merge Tool" dropdown box and merging using it works.a†----h3. Background / related issues:h4. Related bug:The buga†SRCTREEWIN-4572 ("Can't select WinMerge as merge tool") from 2016 was Done because WinMerge didn't yet support a 3-way merge. But as of 2018-01-28 WinMerge has supported 3-way merge (See WinMerge [2.15.2 changelog|https://github.com/WinMerge/winmerge/blob/master/Docs/Users/ChangeLog.md#winmerge-2152---2018-01-28] from 2018-01-28: "Add support for 3-way compare/merge"). I tried today (2021-03-08) using WinMerge 3-way merge with the custom merge option using the information from this [Sourcetree Community question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Can-t-launch-external-merge-tool-WinMerge-on-Windows/qaq-p/315156] and it worked okay.h4. Currently working custom merge options for WinMerge:The options I used in Sourcetree 3.4.3 for Windows 64-bit with WinMerge 2.16.10.0 x64 and which worked for merging: * Options > Diff > External Diff / Merge: ** Merge Tool: Custom ** Merge Command: C:\Program Files\WinMerge\WinMergeU.exe *** Arguments:{noformat}-wl -wr -dl Remote -dm Base -dr Local \"$REMOTE\" \"$BASE\" \"$LOCAL\" -o \"$MERGED\"{noformat}a†

Summary: Remote project configuration error when creating a Pull Request after starting app
Description: Being prompted to "Run 'git lfs pull' now?" despite all lfs files up to date when open a tab to a repository.Looks like the implementation ofa†RepoHandlerGitOld.NeedsLargeFilesPull has been not quite right for a while.According to the lfs [source|https://github.com/git-lfs/git-lfs/blob/2e1d981afbe33bd6b9bebb9943daf236636e5e33/commands/command_ls_files.go#L149]a†for the output,a†*ALL* files will be output. Those that exist and are the same size will be annotated with a '*', those that don't with a '-'.{{701ab1713a2cacb797738ab5220a5ed640f1c38affb71e83cc6ac9bd53c35d13 - deletedfile.txt}} {{a6c2fde49d61d6226446ff0fb3d78db15ebae71da9fb505e17a32a1cb4f93ac4 * intactfile.txt}}Currently, SourceTree will prompt if the *first* line matchesa† "[0-9a-fA-F]\{64} . .+", which is always.a†Proposed fix:Change the regex to search for "[0-9a-fA-F]\{64} *-* .+" (changing the first dot to a minus) so that it only looks for files reported by LFS that need to be updated.a†The reason that 3.4.1 doesn't have this issue, is that the *first* file will be investigated for a string that contains "git-lfs.github.com".a†Related to #[13418|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-13418]

Summary: Cannot pull changes
Description: There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows introduced through git-lfs. An attacker could create a malicious repository which, after being cloned in SourceTree for Windows and enabled with git-lfs, is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.¬†*This is the result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-27955**Affected versions:* * Version¬†3.4.2 and earlier¬†*Fix* * You can download the latest version of¬†the [standard installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.3.9.exe] or the [enterprise installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourcetreeEnterpriseSetup_3.3.9.msi].¬†For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+for+Windows+Security+Advisory+24th+March+2021]

Summary: Sourcetree crashes on launch 99% of the time
Description: The current Sourcetree version 3.4.3 terminates a running pageant process even though it was not started by Sourcetree.The corresponding option to start pageant when Sourcetree is started is disabled. The running pageant process should not be touched by Sourcetree if it was not started by Sourcetree itself.This behavior has not been noticeable in previous versions. This behavior is traceable on two different Windows installations.Besides, the versions of putty-tools installed with Sourcetree are a bit outdated.The current version 3.4.3 cannot (yet) be selected for the bugreport.

Summary: Crash on "Show In Explorer"
Description: When adding a new tag Sourcetree uses the current date on that tag. The tag date is then used by the Github UI for ordering releases. If tags were not added chronologically, the releases are displayed out of sequence.a†This can be avoided by settinga†GIT_COMMITTER_DATE to the date of the commit before adding the tag.a†I suggest adding this as an option under the Advanced Options of the Tag dialog.

Summary: Remote repositories search can't find some repos
Description: I just installed *SourceTree* version *3.4.2* and find that I cannot create a pull request.In the previous version (not remembering which one I had installed) I could solve this with the recommendation indicated in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Unable-to-Create-Pull-Request-Default-Browser-Empty/qaq-p/1213475].But this no longer works. Under this condition, to reproduce the behavior you just have to create a branch from Sourcetree in any repository and then try to create a pull request.The _*Remote*_ button on the toolbar never changes state, always showing the _exclamation point_ even though my credentials and token are correct and up to date.¬†

Summary: Sourcetree is freesing on large binary files

I clearly made a typo, one starts with an uppercase B and the other with a lowercase b.When I use those branches locally sourcetree puts them automatically in the same folder: * bugfixes ** bug1 ** bug2This is no a bad thing in itself, it's actually a good thing. But when I try to push my commits to origin it tries to push them to 'bugfixes/bug2', that does not exist.¬†It's like sourcetree uses the folder name to reconstruct the origin branch's name instead of the actual origin branch's name.¬†The 'Affects Versions' field doesn't have the option but my version is 3.3.8.3848

Summary: Crash on checking out branch from browser
Description: Hi. Using SourceTree (ST) v3.1.2 (but problem exists also in the latest version).ST insists handling a specific repo upon any attempt to clone any other repo.Imagine this: You ask to clone repo A and get in return repo Z;a†You ask to clone repo B and again repo Z is cloned (in this case, repo Z is called "su4_pom_emv_shared") .Actions done: * Uninstalled ST * Shift-del folder _Atlassian_a†under c:\users\<user> * Shift-del folder _SourceTree_ under c:\users\<user> * Searched all over in the Registry for the problematic repo. Zero results * Searched all over in C: drive for suspicious files containing the name of the problematic repo. Zero results * Cleareda†_Temp_ folder of Windows * Created fresh set of SSH keys (just in case) * Re-installed ST ** With and without Mercurial (same result) ** With and without keys (PuTTY / SSH) (same result)Now get this: As long as keep using ST without exiting the application, everything seems to be fine (i.e. capable to clone any repo plus even Branch, Merge, Push and Pull successfully). But once you *EXIT* the application and restart it - BOOM! it masses up (see enDone images)I get the error-message _*fatal: refused to merge unrelated histories*_ for**a†_**_a†no reasonAs a last resort I logged in Bitbucket and renamed the repo. Ever since everything got stuck.Moreover: $ git pull works fine; gitk (other git GUI) works fineWill appreciate to have any assistance to resolve this irritating problem.Thank you.Links to 3 images:[Image 1|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1mQsxgtbvVwfGUVUG8u2hefJL00io3hS2][Image 2|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1n4U-XVm30MAaRaCdeTrw8sVjtPMlFuzH][Image 3|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1WajxgXxZ7743bxPN4vs-0ObinQnj3UuV]a†

After that Sourcetree tells me that it is no valid URL. Details show these error:a†{code:java}Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote <myrepo>Output:Error: fatal: repository '<myrepo>' not foundCommand: perl.exe <SourceTree-InstallPath>\tools\svn.pl info <myrepo>Output:Error: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the specified file{code}a†Trying to install perl did not help and had no effect on these errors.a†I performed the clone command on git bash and it worked. Summary: Select Next Unstaged File when clicking "Stage Selected"
Description: There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows introduced through git-lfs. An attacker could create a malicious repository which, after being cloned in SourceTree for Windows and enabled with git-lfs, is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.*Affected versions:* * Versiona†3.3.9a†and earliera†*Fix* * You can download the latest version ofa†the [standard installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.3.9.exe] or the [enterprise installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourcetreeEnterpriseSetup_3.3.9.msi].a†For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+for+Windows+Security+Advisory+24th+March+2021]

Summary: Calendar disappears while scrolling the page up or down continuously
Description: h3. Issue SummaryA user is reporting that interactive rebase is not possible in 3.4.0.h3. Steps to ReproduceThere are two ways to start an interactive rebase in Sourcetree. The first is to right-click (or context-click) on a commit and choose Rebase children of <sha> interactively‚Ä¶ The second is to pull down the Repository menu and select Interactive rebase.h3. Expected ResultsThe rebase executes.h3. Actual ResultsThe user has reported that there are no interactive rebase GUI capabilities available.h3. WorkaroundCurrently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Summary: Site performance is very low because image are large
Description: SYMPTOMI have a large project with ~100 tags. I installed on a new system and noticed that while "fetch" from remote worked fine, I could not "push" to remote (bitbucket). It would simply sit there doing nothing then after about a minute I would see "FATAL ERROR: Server unexpectedly Done network connection".a† It doesn't matter what I am pushing - not even a basic commit will work.WORKAROUNDIf I disable "Push all tags to remotes" it works fine.a†a†NOTEThis is NOT specific to the repo. I have another workstation with the same setup, and "Push" works fine, even with "Push all tags... enabled"STEPS: # enable "Push all tags..." # make a change # commit locally # push # observe does not work and eventually gives error message # disable "Push all tags..." # observe works

Summary: Staging in a shared submodule leads to deletion of files
Description: Stash dialog 'Keep staged changes' checkbox doesn't work.When you check it and press 'OK' on the stash dialog with this checkbox checked, all changes discarded. in working tree.a†Could not select proper affected version 3.3.4.3796, so pick 3.2.2, 3.2.4 and 3.3.9!image-2020-12-02-05-27-04-354.png!

Summary: Sourcetree fails to install or open.
Description: Packages are not refreshing with new pull requests automatically. Refresh button is suggestible for viewing new pull requests in the dashboard of Source tree.

Summary: Can't push branch to Azure Git
Description: When you choose "external diff" in a log window, rather than opening the diff for file you are logging, it opens the diff for the file you have selected in the main sourcetree window.

Summary: Custom actions not working
Description: I got a new PC and ported all my settings to the new one. So old PC is Win 7 ann new one is Win 10. The global gitignore file set in the git settings is not used for display in Sourcetree but it is used in command line git.It seems this is an old issue, as it is also reported here:[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/SourceTree-ignoring-global-gitignore-on-Win10/qaq-p/1029968]¬†maybe it is also related to SRCTREEWIN-7387

Summary: "Check out in Sourctree" always tries to clone new and complains about missing details.
Description: Basically I want to report https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1655a†again.By the time I write this, that is a low priority bug, Done as obsolete years ago - but time to time, users (including me) add comments about they still experiencing the issue. I guess a Done bug won't get much attention, so I open a new one.

Summary: Problem when trying setup sourcetree
Description: the filea†sourcetreeconfig.json store in .git folder is always refresh to clean empty version after every launch of sourcetreea†a†it is very annoying to lost a lot of config made in every local git repositorya†

Summary: Authentication not working
Description: If you have same names of repos, then if you opened one of this, and want to open second then open first

Summary: Can't use authentication options
Description: When I installed Sourcetree, Ia† chose not to install Mercurial, because I am using the app with Git, I started getting a "Pageant" credentials dialog whenever I start the Sourcetree app, and I think I remember Pageant being connected to Mercurial, though I'm not sure.a†Now, whenever I start Sourcetree, I get a tiny Pageant credentials dialog. It wants me to enter a passphrase for a specific key, which is listed in Hex.I found a pageant.exe in my Putty folder for some reason, and thought it had been installed by mistake. I deleted the pageant.exe. However, now when I start Sourcetree, I still get the Pageant credentials dialog.a†When I search online for the Pageant app, all I get is application forms for Miss whatever beauty pageants.a†Do you have any idea what the Pageant app is, and why it would try to start when Sourcetree starts? (I think it might have to do with Mercurial, so I chose that component. But, I am NOT using Mercurial. I use Git.)Note: I am seeing now that I am on an unreleased version of Sourcetree, which may explain some of this. Do I have to uninstall it and install the latest released version? Sounds like a lot of work, and I don't have time today. :(
