Description: I pressed "Show In Explorer" and the crash occurs.Here is the dump.

Summary: Add an Account in Remote Tab Opens Edit Hosting Account Window with Username in Ready Only
Description: I had a brunch which I deleted from both local and origin using GitKraken and then I verified from the Git brunch is deleted from Git Bash as well. However, that brunch still shows in Source Tree, even after refresh or fetch origin and when I try to delete the same brunch, it actually pushes the brunch to remote and then delete it again.

Summary: Unable to open Web Browser Message
Description: *Background:* Since Github is phasing out basic login with password, its important that login with PAT is simple and works for usersa†*Issue:* SourceTree will fail basic login with PAT unless a specific, non-obvious permission is granted (which is not enabled by default in GitHub GUI)a†*Repro:*1. create Personal Access Token from Github developer options with default permissions, or repo permissions2. use PAT as password in SourceTree basic login3. Fails with message to the affect of "user not found"a†Fix: User must check `user:email` permission (not checked by default), otherwise SourceTree will fail login. !image-2020-11-15-15-14-23-474.png!Since its hard to guess this will be needed (and it's disabled by default in Github), it would be great if sourcetree could give a hint on this error i.e. "is \"user:email\" permission set in your PAT?"(Assuming the permission really is necessary for login / common operations.If not, even better would be login succeeding without it)a†NOTE: My SourceTree is version `3.3.6`. The `Affects Version/s` dropdown doesn't accept that, so I selected `3.3.9`

Summary: update branch from remote master (as in Github Desktop)
Description: In some situations new files are not shown in the unstaged files with _pending_ active._I'm not sure what these situations are yet._The git command used by sourcetree is:a†`git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks status --porcelain --ignore-submodules=dirty --untracked-files=all --no-ahead-behind`a†Which includes them prefixed with `A`, however sourcetree refuses to show them in Pending or Untracked, only in *Clean* and All.a†_This is an annoying bug since you may forget to add files._

Summary: Unable to pull the new updates from the branch"failed to aunthenticate"
Description: Same bug also reported at SourceTree for Mac.SourceTree hangs when I click on and mouse wheel on the different area on the bottom right corner.It seems that this happens only when I click on the diff. on the XAML file.Below is a configuration that will hang my SourceTree. Clicking on the Resource.xaml, and then trying to scroll the bottom right area that highlights the different in code patch, and the program will hang; there is now no response when I click on any other area.I'm using latest version.!https://i.imgur.com/kkF5lH6.png!

Summary: Can't rearrange bookmarks
Description: I've found a type in the GUI, probably only in the German translation, but I didn't check. To enter the menu rightclick on a branch name.It should be "Hole <branchname>" instead of "Hole<branchname>" -> a space is missing.!image-2020-11-10-11-38-45-235.png!

Summary: File status not updated automatically anymore
Description: On my Remote accounts, I have an account set up for Azure DevOps.as reference * [account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com] ** Member of [http://dev.azure.com/organization1|http://dev.azure.com/organisation1] ** Member of [http://dev.azure.com/organization2|http://dev.azure.com/organisation2]I am trying to add another DevOps account now to SourceTree:a†[account2@domain2.com|mailto:account2@domain2.com]a†that is also linked to organization 2 on DevOpsas reference * [account2@domain2.com|mailto:account2@domain2.com] ** Member ofa†[http://dev.azure.com/organization2|http://dev.azure.com/organisation2]a†The problem seems that username ([account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com])a†is sent through, instead of the PAT which then does not authenticate on DevOps Orgnaisation2To do this I do the following steps: # Select Tools Menu # Select Options # Select Authentication Tab ##a†a list of my accounts is displayed, including an existing connection to azure dev-ops #a†Click "Add" to add a new account. # Select Azure DevOps as the Hosting service # Enter the URL, for a different organization ## https://my2nddevopsorginsation.visualstudio.com # Click "Refresh Personal Access Token" # I enter my PAT as both username and password and click OK ## checking password wheels spin ## the error comes back as follows:{color:#0747a6}_an account already exists for 'account1@domain1.com@organization2.visualstudio.com_{color}so according to the error, [account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com]a†is passed as the username,a†instead of trying to use the username that I send through since account1@domain.com, is not in any way related to the account I am trying to setup, it must be a bug that this is sent through as a username, instead of the username that I specify.a†after clicking ok, the username field is changed to my [account1@domain1.com|mailto:account1@domain1.com]a†even though that is not the username that I specified.a†!image-2020-11-10-11-43-27-408.png!a†!image-2020-11-10-11-44-15-482.png!a†!image-2020-11-10-11-45-10-086.png!a†so to be precise:a† from the screenshotsa† [gerriep@evolvemed.co.za|mailto:gerriep@evolvemed.co.za]a†would by my account1@domain1.com,a† which is nothing to do with what I am trying to setup, but somehow sourcetree populates this info in to the username and error message

Summary: Repository is not opened if a tab with another repository having the same name already exists
Description: Windows 10.0.18363 x64 - GITSourceTree version 3.3.9I have this very frequent bug lately (multiple times a day). When I view the files diffs (staging or commit), if I scroll down to the bottom of the file, it will freeze the UI and I have to close the process to restart.Not all files trigger this freeze, but when one does, it will freeze everytime when I scrolldown (so I can reproduce the bug easily on my end). It seems related to the Diff "context" since, when I reduce it, the freeze doesn't occur on the same files (behavior change).The freeze is instant, as soon as the Diff panel hits the end-of-file, it freezes.I didn't have this bug in the previous version (3.3.6)

Summary: Display problems of "unusual" characters in main window diff pane
Description: h4. Environment * Windows 7 Professional 64-bit ** Outdated, I know * Sourcetree v3.3.8.3848h4. Steps to Reproduce # Commit a text file # Write a huge amount of lines (e.g. 20,000 lines) to the file # Add and commit the change # Show "History" pageh4. Current Behavior * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, and a user can't do anything but just wait for a long time or terminate this app because it never releases the whole control before finishing everythingh4. Appreciated BehaviorAny one (or more) of these: * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, but a timeout occurs because it took too long time to load ** It would be great if the timeout length can be modified in preferences. * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, but a user can interrupt it anytime by pressing Esc key or a kind of "Cancel" button * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, but a user can interrupt it anytime by clicking on another file or commit with light changes because loading is processed only in the diff pane at the lower right * Sourcetree displays diffs partly only within the scrolled area of the diff pane * Sourcetree doesn't start to display diffs automatically before selecting a file in commits ** It's just like the diff pane of the "File Status" page says "Select a file to view the diff" when no files are selected. * Sourcetree doesn't start to display the huge diff automatically because this app knows its hugeness before the loading ** It's just like GitHab says "Large diffs are not rendered by default" when showing commit detail page. * Or another cool solution...

Summary: Cannot get past "Registration" step of installer
Description: Suggestion : ability to hide (or disable) the diff pane (or its real time update) in File Status view.Reason : when multi selecting files (in order to stage, discard or whatever action we want to apply), each selection change updates the diff pane content. When those files of big or binary, that update made by the diff can easily freeze SourceTree for multiple seconds, and the bigger you extend your selection, the worse it is.I've been in cases where I had to fight for more than a minute to get a selection of less than 10 files.While it is really unlikely that we want to show multiple files diffs at once in the same view (for ergonomic/readability reason), it is really common to select multiple file to take actions on them. This diff update freeze makes it really painful to apply actions on multiple files in your software.

Summary: Failure to install and also failure to set install location
Description: There was a vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS and windows that could reveal Git user credentials via maliciously crafted URL by an attacker, This vulnerability is triggered when the affected version of Git is used to execute a git clone command on a malicious URL.Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree For Mac allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree for Windows allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.*Affected versions:* * Windows version 3.2.2 and earlier*Fixed versions:* * Windows versiona†3.3.9*Released Sourcetree for Windows versiona†3.3.9*a†that contains fixes for these issues and can be downloaded froma†[https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/].For additional details, see thea†[full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SOURCETREEKB&title=SourceTree+Security+Advisory+2020-09-02]

Summary: Unable to use Sourcetree and downlod repository on second machine
Description: A silly behaviour I have noticed, for some years now. * Create a new branch in Visual Studio. Create some commits. * Try to push the branch to GitHub in SourceTree by using the 'Push' button. * Check the new branch in the popup. The local name is copied as remote name. * Press 'Push' in the popup. An error is displayed: "The Remote branch '' (Local branch = 'MyName') is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: [https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html] Completed with errors, see above." * Now CUT the remote name, and PASTE IT BACK. Now pushing works! I don't know why, I don't see spaces or anything.A silly little trick to get it working. But I must have been banging my head before I ever found it!

Summary: Diff isn't showing tabs correctly if "show invisibles" is enabled
Description: Heyho,I set up a shared submodule, and whenever I stage a file in Sourcetree it shows that all files contents are deleted, so effectively Sourcetree states that I am staging a deleted file. When I unstage, the file is deleted. When I add the file via the terminal, it all works flawlessly. I think the tricky thing here is the shared submodule part, with which Sourcetree has trouble. While it could be that I am doing something wrong, I have the belief that Sourcetree is doing more than a simple 'git add' (as that works from the command line).I set up the shared submodule as followed:1. Clone the project that should serve as the shared submodule locally to some directory2. In the shared submodule, modify the local config of this project by adding 'worktree = ..' under [core]For all projects sharing this submodule:3. Add the submodule (this means, effectively I now have two checked out copies of that project)4. Delete the respective submodule folder in ./git/submodule/5. Delete the content of the submodule directory apart from the .git file6. Modify the .git in the submodule directory to point to the path of the project setup in 1)a†(reason for shared submodule is that we have the same code base across different projects, and this way I can change a file in the code base once and it is applied to all projects without having to pull their respective submodule first)

Summary: Error pushing new branches
Description: Branch is not shown in Push window if renamed during checkout from remote. Steps to reproduce: # Double click or right click and checkout a remote branch (in origin). # In the popup window rename the branch. # Branch is created locally with the new name, but does not show up in the Push window, both through the toolbar Push button and through the Push option in the right click menu on the branch.(Workaround:) Create another branch locally from this locally renamed branch by clicking Branch in the toolbar. This new branch can be pushed as expected.This only happens when renaming the remote branch on checkout. If it is not renamed, it can be pushed as expected.Tested in Sourcetree for Windows 3.3.8.End.

Summary: Order Center Table
Description: h3. Use CaseIn our project, due to the branching model, most of the merges are none `fast-forward` merges. Therefore, I have set `git config merge.ff false` in my config in case I am merging from the terminal. However, with this setting I am not capable any longer to "force" a `fast-forward` merge from Sourcetree! Even if I uncheck *Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible*, Sourcetree triggers a "normal" merge thus falling back onto the settings from the git config.h3. Cause of the issueSourcetree calls {{git merge branch-name}}a†whena†*Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible*a†is not checked:```git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks merge branch-name```h3. SuggestionBe explicit with the command that is triggered by Sourcetree when unchecking. That is, ...... either make `git merge --ff branch-name` the command which is triggered (instead of `git merge branch-name`),... or even provide a option likea†*Require fast-forward merge*a†triggeringa†`git merge --ff-only branch-name`.

Summary: file status is not refreshing
Description: Applies to v3.3.8I had a case where P4Merge was called to resolve a conflict in a too large .js file and it hung in the background. It seemed like nothing had happened so I attempted to resolve again, but got a warning that attempting to use P4Merge on such a large file could cause P4Merge to hang. I opted to not launch the external merge tool. Not having a clear picture what was in my local file, I committed the changes. Also, the file status filter was set to "Modified" so I didn't notice the untracked conflict files. There are multiple areas for improvement here. 1. Detect when external merge tool fails to release conflict files and provide a warning2. Check for presence of unresolved merge conflict files, esp. for recent conflict resolution attempts3. Make "unstaged changes" more visible

Summary: unable to use sourcetree to upload local programming into bitbucket
Description: Files encoded with UTF-16 LE (little endian) without BOM (Byte Order Mark) does not display correctly. Every other character is displayed as a space (see screenshot).To reproduce: # Save a text file as "sample.txt" in a git repository with encoding of UTF-16LE (without BOM) ## To do this I use the SublimeText3 "Save with encoding" feature # Add the line{code:java}**/*sample.txt text working-tree-encoding=UTF-16LE{code}to the ".gitattributes" file which should let Git understand how to interpret the file. (this should make it show up correctly) # Look at the file in the diff view in source tree (see screenshot)Screenshot:!image-2020-03-02-09-04-20-243.png!To verify fix: # make sure that the diff view now works with files that are encoded with BOTH of the following encodings: ## UTF-16 LE (without BOM) ## UTF-16 LE BOM (WITH BOM)a†

Summary: Commit text links are lost when closing and reopening app
Description: The diff embedded in SourceTree isn't showing tabs correctly when "show invisibles" is enabled.The correct way to show tabs in this situation is to show a single "invisible" where the tab is, then indent as much as you need for a single tab, then (if there's a second tab) show another invisible and indent again, etc.Currently instead it shows all the invisibles at the beginning of the line, and the invisible dots in apparently arbitrary places.Since I've noticed that also the dots for the spaces are all messed up, I guess that whenever there are tabs, all of the invisibles do not show correctly._(for some reason I found no way to attach screenshots for now, I'll try to add them as links later)__(also for some reason it doesn't allow me to select version 3.3.8, which is the one I'm using - on Windows 10)_

Summary: This is not a valid source path / URL
Description: Configuration for use with gerrit requires modifying a repos origin push to :refs/heads/*:refs/for/*.this worked great with 3.1.3 and earlier versions.a† Now, we just get a push window with absolutely NO branches or anything so it is impossible to push changes unless auto-pushing using the checkmark to push directly upon committing.a† This is ok in normal scenarios, but as soon as you enter complex scenarios like wishing to ammend a checked-out commit that someone else has pending in gerrit, which requires creating a local branch, we normally have to manually tell it to push it to the correct refs/for/correctBranch.a† this is now impossible.a† See screenshots that I will add as comments to the issue to see the 3.1.3 behaviour and the latest behaviour (same in all versions more recent than 3.1.3)Please correct this, it forces our teams to remain on 3.1.3 just to function.

Summary: Can't access bitbucket using sourcetree
Description: On GitLab repository files are not refreshed automaticallya†To SourceTree see changes user have to refresh automatically (with F5)a†All Refresh toggles in Options and Repository settings are enabled.a†It was on versiona† 3.3.7, couldn't set it in Issue because latest "Affects Version/s" there are 3.2.2/3.2.4

Summary: Special Unicode Character in Filename
Description: After installing using the downloaded windows installation file 'SourceTreeSetup-3.3.6.exe' there are no start menu shortcuts that are created.Environment: Windows 10 Pro ver 1903 - os build# 18362.592SourceTree Version: 3.3.6Expected: Shortcuts are installed to the start menuActual: No shortcuts are installed to the start menuWorkaround: create them manually AFTER looking up the forced installation path in the user profile (I really would have prefered a choice here, but whateves).a†Steps to Reproduce: # Using the SourceTreeSetup-3.3.6.exe installation file, run to install the app # Follow the installation wizard and complete the installation # No shortcuts were created for SourceTree, and for some odd reason only the installation executable shows up after the installationI also installed using the context menu shortcut "Run as Administrator".I just reinstalled windows, so I highly doubt that is part of the problem, but who knows stranger things have happened.I have no idea why your Affects Version/s only lets me select up to 3.2.4, and 3.3.x does not exist.Thank you for looking into this. Let me know if you want the specific install executable. Take care!

Summary: Numbers on tabs, but nothing to pull or commit/push...?
Description: At least since 3.3.6 (maybe earlier) but also in 3.3.7 and 3.3.8 the "Open in Terminal" button isn't working anymore (it's not opening the terminal)It seems that also for custom actions that have the "Open in a separate window" checkbox checked, it's not opening the git bash window anymore when running the custom actionIt seems that an identical issue existed before, but was fixed in the meantime, but apparently re-introduced:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-3896

Summary: "Refresh automatically when file changes" and "Refresh when application is not in focus" doesn't work
Description: # Create a file in a language for which syntax highlighting is available in SourceTree (I experience this bug with {{.sql}} files) and don't end it with a newline character. # Add the file to a repository # View the file diff (for the file add) in SourceTreeAfter the last numbered line in the file, the diff displays:{code:java}\  No newline at end of file{code}For {{.sql}} files, the line reads with {{at end of file}} coloured in blue as if they were part of the file syntax. The notice should appear all in one colour.Reproduced in SourceTree 3.3.6, not 3.2.2, but Jira doesn't seem to permit this as an option.

Summary: Creating branches: replace disallowed characters with dashes
Description: Hi,When I do any action from my first tab project (fetch, pull, push, change the selected branch, ...), the display never refresh and then I have to quit and start again SourceTree to resfresh, in order to avoid errors while managing my project branches.a†I thinked that was from my local repository. But after recloning my project in a new local repository renamed, same behaviour again. Then when I change the order of my tabs in SourceTree, the tab in first position only have the problem to not resfresh all actions !My version is 3.3.6 for Windows (not available in the Affects Version/s list below)Thanks !

Summary: On push not select baranches
Description: When I create a new branch and try to push it, in the push screen I check the new branch and it automatically fills the "Remote branch" field with the proper name. However, when I confirm the push, I get this error:a†{{The Remote branch '' (Local branch = 'feature/test') is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: }}{{https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html}}{{Completed with errors, see above.}}a†I noticed that just deleting one char from the Remote branch name and reinsert it fix the problem.a†The version I'm using is 3.3.4.

Summary: Git flow not automatically branching from correct branch
Description: Hello,I recently started using Sourcetree for a fun modding project. I foolishly created a repo of the entire source even though I didn't need most of it.Working on my D partition it had about 20GB space left but the initial commit was around 30GB. Sourcetree did not realize that this was not going to fit for a temporary staging location it tried to create, and eventually filled my SSD's remaining capacity (literally, 0 bytes remaining) The staging process then failed due to this but somehow still exited with a green status code.Since then I'm able to use my local repo even if I made it absurdly large for my purposes, but every screen hangs and no files I stage or commit or any commits I make update the context at all, though that may have already been an issue and I just didn't notice it before.¬†However, now my D partition had 97 GB of "Temporary files" that I can't locate and as far as I know aren't Windows files (C is my OS partition). Please help me find and delete any remnants of this failed temp copy action made by Git.MY version of Sourcetree says it's Version 3.3.6, why can't I choose it in the dropdown? O,o!image-2020-01-27-22-42-59-024.png!¬†

Summary: Code scroll not proper in horizontal way
Description: Team,a†a†Trying to clone a repository but getting fatal error exception.Clicked on Clone in Sourcetree>>>!image-2020-01-27-14-59-29-564.png!Tried cloning remote!image-2020-01-27-15-01-52-616.png!a†Getting Fatal Error Exeptiona† -a†!image-2020-01-27-15-03-07-325.png!a†

Summary: Custom chrome issue on hi-dpi screen

Summary: Problems when pushing and pulling
Description: From File Status option, when I select a file to stage and click in the "Stage Selected" button, the file doesnt appears at the "Stage files" list. The commit button was disabled.When I close the SourceTree application and restart it the staged file appears in the "Stage files" list. Then I can commit itThank youI work withSourceTree Version 3.3.6 (The affected version selector has only until 3.2.2)Windows 10 Home 1903 (operating system version 18362.592) andJava version 1.8.0_241 x86_64 architecture¬†

Summary: Allow branch names that start with '/'
Description: Same as before: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-7168It says fixed but you destroyed it again in version 3, apparently.h3. Problem DefinitionSourceTree gets installed ina†_{{%localappdata%\SourceTree\}}_a†folder and it's not possible for the users to change the installation location.Some users would like to be able to do so, e.g. because this folder is protected by an antivirus and to start the program, they have to disable the scanner once.h3. Suggested SolutionAllow users to select the installation location for SourceTree.h3. AdditionallyWhat's up with programs lately just installing themselves into appdata and in C:\Program FIles\ without asking? Why do you think you can decide for me where I want to install it? Chrome, Discord, Sourcetree and some othera†impudent programs that think they know better. You don't know better. I have 3 places where I install my programs:a ¢ Windows drive C:\ on SSD for drivers and the most core stuff like .NET and C++ redistributables, Windows updates.a ¢ Second SSD drive D:\ for programs that require performance: UE4 editor, UE4 Engines, Visual Studio, etc.a ¢ And then I have hard drive G:\ for all other programs.Sourcetree would go on the HDD because it doesn't require good performance SSDs provide and it isn't a core part of the system.Let us install programs where we want, not where you want.

Summary: Remote not showing private GitHub repos
Description: Configuration for use with gerrit requires modifying a repos origin push to :refs/heads/*:refs/for/*.this worked great with 3.1.3 and earlier versions.¬† Now, we just get a push window with absolutely NO branches or anything so it is impossible to push changes unless auto-pushing using the checkmark to push directly upon committing.¬† This is ok in normal scenarios, but as soon as you enter complex scenarios like wishing to ammend a checked-out commit that someone else has pending in gerrit, which requires creating a local branch, we normally have to manually tell it to push it to the correct refs/for/correctBranch.¬† this is now impossible.¬† See screenshots that I will add as comments to the issue to see the 3.1.3 behaviour and the latest behaviour (same in all versions more recent than 3.1.3)Please correct this, it forces our teams to remain on 3.1.3 just to function.

Summary: Using external working directory causes staging changes to produces unpredictable results.
Description: The option "Refresh automatically when files change" no longer works in 3.3.7. It was working fine in 3.3.6. What used to happen was when SourceTree gained focus, if anything had changed it would auto refresh. This no longer occurs. (NOTE: option "Refresh when application is not in focus" is disabled)In fact even operations initiated in Sourcetree no longer refresh. For example creating or applying a stash doesn't actually update the repo view, you have to manually hit F5 to force a refresh. Again this was working fine in 3.3.6.This is causing major issues for us as it means you are operating in a stale view of the repo unless you keep constantly hitting F5 to force a full refresh.

Summary: Enhance Real Date Choice to Issue Type in Issue Type Scheme

Summary: Stashing local changes creates a new commit and pushes
Description: A lot of other developers at my work experience the same issue with the latest sourcetree version 3.3.6. We had to downgrade to 3.1.2 which is the latest stable version.a†I think 3.3.7 behaves in the same way. as 3.3.6, so is also unstable.a†The jira menu below asks me to report a bug on a specific sourcetree version, however 3.3.6/7 isn't an option on there, so I will submit the latest version that does come up in the dropdown - 3.2.2, however I am sure that version is actually fine. Not sure why the latest versions don't come up in the dropdown. Within the actual sourcetree it prompts me to upgrade to 3.3.7, so I assume this dropdown on Jira is out of date.a†ISSUE DESCRIPTION - {color:#FF0000}*Affects 3.3.6 and 3.3.7*{color}:When you update to another branch, the view still shows that you are on the previous branch. Once I close the app completely and reopen, only then it is then obvious that I have checked out another branch. So it does update in the background, however the view isn't updating correctly.a†Similarly when you stage files, it shows them in the unstaged section until I shut the app down, reopen it and then find them in the staged section.a†a†Similarly creating a new branch - it doesn't show the new branch on the side bar at all until shutting down and reopening the app.a†Im using windows 10 if this helps.

The 2.x versions were fine in this aspect, and I think even 3.1 was reasonable; 3.2 and 3.3 are not reasonable.

Summary: User cannot rearrange repositories when they are located in a folder in the "Local Repositories" window
Description: Branches list does allow only one branch to be selected. It doesn't support selection with Shift or Ctrl. That makes branches deletion process almost impossible when you have to delete 20-30 branches at once. I use SourceTree all the time, but run SmartGit when I clean up repository only because SmartGit can select multiple branches.Menu "Branches -> Delete" supposed to help in multiple branches deletion, but it doesn't allow to select multiple branches at once, doesn't support Shift and/or Space to check branches checkboxes, so using SmartGit is still faster than this.

Summary: Support using of multiple ssh-keys through Sourcetree interface
Description: I get a crash whenever attempting to initiate a pull request. I'm doing so by rt-clicking on the branch and selecting "Create pull request..."The log consistently displays the following:{{ERROR [2019-11-27 08:38:23,189] [1] [SourceTree.Analytics.Crash.BugSplat.CrashAnalyticsService] [Log] - DispatcherUnhandledExceptionHandler for [Sourcetree, 3.2.6.3544] called with [System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher, System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherUnhandledExceptionEventArgs]}}{{System.UriFormatException: Invalid URI: The format of the URI could not be determined.}}{{ at System.Uri.CreateThis(String uri, Boolean dontEscape, UriKind uriKind)}}{{ at Sourcetree.Host.GitLab.AbstractGitLabHost.GetPullRequestUri(String baseUrl, String repoSlug, String ownerOrProject, String remoteBranch, String commitSha)}}{{ at Sourcetree.Host.GitLab.AbstractGitLabHost.GetPullRequestUri(String baseUrl, String remoteUrl, String remoteBranch, String commitSha)}}{{ at SourceTree.Model.Repository.CreatePullRequest(String remote, String remoteBranch, String commitSHA)}}{{ at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.CreatePullRequestNoPrompt(String remote, String remoteBranch)}}{{ at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.CreatePullRequestNoPromptIfNotAhead(String localBranch, String remote, String remoteBranch)}}{{ at MS.Internal.Commands.CommandHelpers.CriticalExecuteCommandSource(ICommandSource commandSource, Boolean userInitiated)}}{{ at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InvokeClickAfterRender(Object arg)}}{{ at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)}}{{ at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)}}I've tried using both https and ssh to resolve the remote, with no difference in behavior.I'm guessing this may be related toa†https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-11179a†anda†https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-10775a†

Summary: Repair stash External Diff when diff tool is custom
Description: SourceTree may not allow the user to open a local repository, and will instead select another tab that is already open. This happens when the repo is also a submodule of another repo and the submodule is already open in another tab. Steps to reproduce:Git repository 'A' cloned to C:\GitRoot\AGit repository 'B' cloned to C:\Git\Root\BRepo B is also a submodule of A, so a copy also exists in C:\GitRoot\A\B.Open repo A.In Submodules section of repo A, double-click repo B to open it in another tab.Click '+' to the right of tabs. In Local Repositories double-click repository B (i.e. the clone in C:\GitRoot\B).A new tab should open for repo B, however the repo B (submodule) tab is selected instead.This is a fairly new bug in SourceTree that affects version {color:#ffbdad}+*3.3.4*+{color:#172b4d} (which is not available in the Jira Affected Version/s field).{color}{color}
